snippet: All past and present partners could lose pensions, and recent partners will probably lose investments in the firm and could be forced to return salaries as the firm closes.
abstract: Partners and retirees of collapsing law firm Dewey & LeBoeuf are likely to lose their pensions and money that they invested in the firm; creditors could also force some former employees to return past earnings.

byline.contributor: David Kocieniewski and Peter Lattman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: All past and present partners could lose pensions, and recent partners will probably lose investments in the firm and could be forced to return salaries as the firm closes.

headline.seo: Dewey Partners and Retirees Face Huge Financial Losses
headline.main: As Dewey Collapses, Partners and Retirees Face Big Financial Losses
headline.print_headline: As Dewey Collapses, Partners and Retirees Face Big Financial Losses
